TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit UntrustedRecipientException extends System.Exception

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when the user decides not to trust the entity that is requesting a token after reviewing the information from their certificate.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This exception is thrown when the user clicks "I am not satisfied with this organization's identity/policies" in the [!INCLUDE[infocard](~/includes/infocard-md.md)] user interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: The message that describes the error.
Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of the class with the specified error message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error and takes into account the current system culture. The content of the message should be understandable to the user.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that contains the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of the class with serialized data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: The message that describes the error.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of the class with the specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
